cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking quickly westward toward the south-Texas coastline, then expected to move inland across southern Texas and northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast near Baffin Bay/Corpus Christi area

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Texas coast from the Rio Grande northward to Sargent, including Baffin Bay, Corpus Christi Bay and Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 1-3 in. for mid-TX coast, highest 3-5 in. south of port)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (guidance 1-3 ft in Matagorda Bay, upper bound could reach 3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force wind probabilities remain low (max 7%); brief gusty winds possible Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels 1–3 ft above ground possible in Matagorda Bay Tuesday, leading to minor inundation of low-lying wharves and access roads.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Tuesday could drop 1–3 inches with localized higher totals; drainage issues possible but widespread flooding not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible in rainbands Tuesday.
